title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, July 5, 1863
summary: Hotchkiss recounts to his wife the battles at Gettysburg, and the heavy losses on both sides. He continues two days later, describing the Confederate Army's retreat.
keywords: Troop Movement, Slavery, African Americans, Military Authority, Battle Description, Death/Casualties, Prisons/Prisoners, American Civil War
